data.title: Art and engineering collide at RCB Galleria
data.description: Art collectors and enthusiasts are invited to admire outstanding artwork by top artists during "Driven", which is running at River City Bangkok

data.title: Rhapsody In Blue – a timeless American classic
data.description: On Feb 12, 1924, a concert organised by popular jazz band leader Paul Whiteman was held at the Aeolian Hall in New York City. Despite the cold and snow, the show was jam-packed not only with music fans but also composers like Sergei Rachmaninov and John Philip Souza and popular actors like Gertrude Lawrence.

data.title: Follow Jungkook's journey in new documentary
data.description: As Korean heartthrob Jungkook is serving in the military, Disney+ Hotstar will premiere a new three-part docuseries titled The Original on Dec 3, allowing fans to follow his growth from being a member of BTS to becoming an acclaimed solo artist.

data.title: A gathering of ghosts
data.description: Among Thai ghosts, the top three legends -- Mae Nak, Phee Pob and Phee Krasue -- have frequently featured in films and television series. According to Creative Economy Agency (CEA), Mae Nak has appeared in over 40 films and TV series while Phee Pob has made over 30 appearances in films and TV series.

data.title: Trumpet star Ibrahim Maalouf to perform in Bangkok
data.description: Twice Grammy-nominated trumpet superstar Ibrahim Maalouf will perform live in Bangkok for the first time at Lido Connect, Rama I Road, on Nov 26 at 7.30pm.

data.title: Siam Society marks 120 years with Rama V musical
data.description: To celebrate the 120th anniversary of its founding in the final years of the reign of King Rama V of the Chakri Dynasty, Siam Society presents a special musical performance titled 1907: Rama V European Operatic Journey at its auditorium. There are four rounds at 7pm on Nov 26, 28 and 30 and a matinee show at 4pm on Dec 1.

data.title: Stolen Lennon watch saga ends
data.description: GENEVA - A rare watch given to  John Lennon  by his wife Yoko Ono and stolen after his death does not belong to an Italian man who bought it from an auction house years later, a Swiss court has ruled, paving the way for its return to Ono.

data.title: Bright lights, big city
data.description: For those trying to find a spot to bask in the joyful mood after releasing a krathong into the Chao Phraya River tomorrow night, the charming neighbourhoods of Phra Nakhon-Pak Klong Talat have been turned into entertainment destinations for the seventh Awakening Bangkok, which runs until this Sunday.

data.title: Artist invites all to inner reflection
data.description: Art viewers are encouraged to focus deeper on inner reflection during "Goood Luck: Glitter Gaze", which is running at Tang Contemporary Art Bangkok until Dec 15.

data.title: Photo exhibition captures the essence of change
data.description: Scientific theories are integrated with art during "Transformation Theory", which is running at West Eden Gallery until Dec 22.

data.title: Moo Deng song ready to top the charts
data.description: The world’s most famous baby hippo is ready to conquer the music world with the release of her first song, Moodeng Moodeng — in four languages to delight global fans.

data.title: Bodyslam scraps 2 shows after ‘Toon’ surgery
data.description: The famous rock band Bodyslam has cancelled two shows this week as lead singer Artiwara “Toon” Kongmalai is recovering from minor surgery carried out on Sunday.

data.title: Lisa wins 2 awards at MTV Europe, Taylor Swift the big winner
data.description: Thai singer Lisa of supergirl group Blackpink received two awards, for best collaboration in a song and biggest fans, at the MTV Europe Music Awards, held in Manchester, England, on Sunday night.

data.title: Music legend Quincy Jones dies at 91
data.description: Quincy Jones, the legendary record producer, composer, and arranger whose transformative influence on American music spanned more than seven decades, has passed away at 91. His publicist, Arnold Robinson, confirmed that Jones died peacefully at his Bel Air home due to complications from pneumonia.

data.title: Three charged in One Direction singer Liam Payne's death
data.description: BUENOS AIRES: Three people have been charged in relation to One Direction singer Liam Payne
